files.title: Overview
files.summary: A PTX statement is either a directive or an instruction. Statements begin with an optional label and end with a semicolon.

files.title: 4.3.1. Directive Statements
files.summary: Directive keywords begin with a dot, so no conflict is possible with user-defined identifiers. files.title: 4.3.2. Instruction Statements
files.summary: Instructions are formed from an instruction opcode followed by a comma-separated list of zero or more operands, and terminated with a semicolon.
